Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the body of an orange-red pottery bowl with convex sides and everted ledge-rim, the fabric is both pink and grey in section, the interior is painted red-brown, the inside of the rim is decorated with four black-painted dots on an off-white ground, partially obscured by a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered in a red-brown slip and very faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394853) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394853)
